arts.ttl: ‘Many times it happened this season’ - Frosty Pep Guardiola highlights his frustration after Real Madrid defeat
arts.sum: The manager said we need to take accountability for what we do on the pitch, I think we do that. "We were right on top at the start of the game and we know Real have quality to come out in the second half.

arts.ttl: Manchester City fans unveil BRUTAL banner mocking Vini Jr after his Ballon d'Or snub... and injured Rodri is seen taking a picture of it!
arts.sum: Manchester City supporters have mocked Real Madrid star Vinicius Jr ahead of their Champions League clash against the Spanish giants.

arts.ttl: Alan Shearer blames 'unacceptable' four-minute VAR delay for injury to Jack Grealish in Man City's Champions League clash against Real Madrid
arts.sum: Grealish was a surprise inclusion in Pep Guardiola 's starting XI for the visit of the European champions on Tuesday night and he made an impact in his short time on the pitch.

arts.ttl: Manchester City injuries: Pep Guardiola suffers double injury blow in Real Madrid Champions League defeat
arts.sum: Manchester City suffer two injury blows during their defeat against Real Madrid on Tuesday night in the Champions League, and face an uphill battle to avoid elimination.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola spotted with scratches on his head for the THIRD time this season after Manchester City's latest Champions League collapse
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola 's ugly habit reared its head once more as Manchester City suffered another collapse in the Champions League on Tuesday night.

arts.ttl: Vinicius makes clear statement over Real Madrid contract: “God willing...”
arts.sum: “It’s very exciting to be able to start discussions with Real Madrid about my contract extension. “My current deal runs until 2027, but I’ve always said I want to play here for a long time, make history, and feel the love of the fans alongside the president and coaching staff,” he stated.

arts.ttl: Ballon d’Or banner gave me strength – Vinicius Junior
arts.sum: Man City fans displayed a picture of Rodri kissing the trophy with the message ‘Stop crying your heart out’, mocking Real’s boycott of the ceremony.

arts.ttl: Even Total Haaland cannot stop Manchester City’s continuing nightmare | Barney Ronay
arts.athr: Barney Ronay at the Etihad Stadium
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola had a plan with his Norwegian striker at the centre, but it was no match for Carlo Ancelotti’s aura Almost, but also, somehow, nowhere near. For Manchester City this was once again an exercise in how to fall apart. For an hour at the Etihad Stadium, City became a flickering version of their best selves, driven on by a selection of creaking first-choice defensive parts lashed together and made to march four abreast into the sun for as long as their limbs could stand. By the time Real Madrid scored their first goal of this game on 60 minutes, half of that string‑and‑brown‑paper back four had either gone off or was already limping. Rico Lewis was being twirled around the place by Vinícius Júnior like a child at a wedding reception disco. And half an hour later, as Jude Bellingham scored to make it 3-2 to Madrid, City’s hopes of making the post‑playoff second knockout phase of this competition had narrowed to a fine point. arts.ttl: Carlo Ancelotti counting on defensive reinforcements for Real Madrid’s Champions League second leg against Man City
arts.sum: Real Madrid just pulled off an impressive and perseverant 3-2 win over Manchester City away from home. The win sets them up perfectly for the second leg which takes place…
